The access method and settings that are used to retrieve the sensitive data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesAvailabilityRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesAvailability operation. Checks whether occurrences of sensitive data can be retrieved for a finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesAvailabilityRequest.FindingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FindingId.
The unique identifier for the finding.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesAvailabilityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesAvailability operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesAvailabilityResponse.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
Specifies whether occurrences of sensitive data can be retrieved for the finding. Possible values are: AVAILABLE, the sensitive data can be retrieved; and, UNAVAILABLE, the sensitive data can't be retrieved. If this value is UNAVAILABLE, the reasons array indicates why the data can't be retrieved.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesAvailabilityResponse.Reasons
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Reasons.
Specifies why occurrences of sensitive data can't be retrieved for the finding. Possible values are:
ACCOUNT_NOT_IN_ORGANIZATION - The affected account isn't currently part of your organization. Or the account is part of your organization but Macie isn't currently enabled for the account. You're not allowed to access the affected S3 object by using Macie.
INVALID_CLASSIFICATION_RESULT - There isn't a corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the finding. Or the corresponding sensitive data discovery result isn't available, is malformed or corrupted, or uses an unsupported storage format. Macie can't verify the location of the sensitive data to retrieve.
INVALID_RESULT_SIGNATURE - The corresponding sensitive data discovery result is stored in an S3 object that wasn't signed by Macie. Macie can't verify the integrity and authenticity of the sensitive data discovery result. Therefore, Macie can't verify the location of the sensitive data to retrieve.
MEMBER_ROLE_TOO_PERMISSIVE - The affected member account is configured to retrieve occurrences of sensitive data by using an IAM role whose trust or permissions policy doesn't meet Macie requirements for restricting access to the role. Or the role's trust policy doesn't specify the correct external ID. Macie can't assume the role to retrieve the sensitive data.
MISSING_GET_MEMBER_PERMISSION - You're not allowed to retrieve information about the association between your account and the affected account. Macie can't determine whether youre allowed to access the affected S3 object as the delegated Macie administrator for the affected account.
OBJECT_EXCEEDS_SIZE_QUOTA - The storage size of the affected S3 object exceeds the size quota for retrieving occurrences of sensitive data from this type of file.
OBJECT_UNAVAILABLE - The affected S3 object isn't available. The object was renamed, moved, or deleted. Or the object was changed after Macie created the finding.
RESULT_NOT_SIGNED - The corresponding sensitive data discovery result is stored in an S3 object that hasn't been signed. Macie can't verify the integrity and authenticity of the sensitive data discovery result. Therefore, Macie can't verify the location of the sensitive data to retrieve.
ROLE_TOO_PERMISSIVE - Your account is configured to retrieve occurrences of sensitive data by using an IAM role whose trust or permissions policy doesn't meet Macie requirements for restricting access to the role. Macie cant assume the role to retrieve the sensitive data.
UNSUPPORTED_FINDING_TYPE - The specified finding isn't a sensitive data finding.
UNSUPPORTED_OBJECT_TYPE - The affected S3 object uses a file or storage format that Macie doesn't support for retrieving occurrences of sensitive data.
This value is null if sensitive data can be retrieved for the finding.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetSensitiveDataOccurrences operation. Retrieves occurrences of sensitive data reported by a finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesRequest.FindingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FindingId.
The unique identifier for the finding.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetSensitiveDataOccurrences operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesResponse.Error
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Error.
If an error occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to retrieve occurrences of sensitive data reported by the finding, a description of the error that occurred. This value is null if the status (status) of the request is PROCESSING or SUCCESS.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesResponse.SensitiveDataOccurrences
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SensitiveDataOccurrences.
A map that specifies 1-100 types of sensitive data reported by the finding and, for each type, 1-10 occurrences of sensitive data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitiveDataOccurrencesResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the request to retrieve occurrences of sensitive data reported by the finding. Possible values are:
ERROR - An error occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to locate, retrieve, or encrypt the sensitive data. The error value indicates the nature of the error that occurred.
PROCESSING - Macie is processing the request.
SUCCESS - Macie successfully located, retrieved, and encrypted the sensitive data.

member.summary:

The custom description of the template.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetSensitivityInspectionTemplateResponse.Excludes
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetUsageStatistics operation. Retrieves (queries) quotas and aggregated usage data for one or more accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsRequest.FilterBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterBy.
An array of objects, one for each condition to use to filter the query results. If you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses an AND operator to join the conditions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of items to include in each page of the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The nextToken string that specifies which page of results to return in a paginated response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsRequest.SortBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortBy.
The criteria to use to sort the query results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsRequest.TimeRange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeRange.
The inclusive time period to query usage data for. Valid values are: MONTH_TO_DATE, for the current calendar month to date; and, PAST_30_DAYS, for the preceding 30 days. If you don't specify a value, Amazon Macie provides usage data for the preceding 30 days.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetUsageStatistics operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsResponse.Records
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Records.
An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the data for an account that matches the filter criteria specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageStatisticsResponse.TimeRange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeRange.
The inclusive time period that the usage data applies to. Possible values are: MONTH_TO_DATE, for the current calendar month to date; and, PAST_30_DAYS, for the preceding 30 days.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageTotalsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetUsageTotals operation. Retrieves (queries) aggregated usage data for an account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageTotalsRequest.TimeRange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeRange.
The inclusive time period to retrieve the data for. Valid values are: MONTH_TO_DATE, for the current calendar month to date; and, PAST_30_DAYS, for the preceding 30 days. If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Macie provides aggregated usage data for the preceding 30 days.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageTotalsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetUsageTotals operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageTotalsResponse.TimeRange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeRange.
The inclusive time period that the usage data applies to. Possible values are: MONTH_TO_DATE, for the current calendar month to date; and, PAST_30_DAYS, for the preceding 30 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetUsageTotalsResponse.UsageTotals
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UsageTotals.
An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the data for a specific usage metric.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GroupCount
member.summary: Provides a group of results for a query that retrieved aggregated statistical data about findings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GroupCount.Count

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GroupCount.GroupKey

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails
member.summary: Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze data in an S3 bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.IsDefinedInJob
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IsDefinedInJob.
Specifies whether any one-time or recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible values are:
TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more jobs and at least one of those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED. Or the bucket matched the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for at least one job that previously ran.
FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any jobs, all the jobs that explicitly include the bucket in their bucket definitions have a status of CANCELLED, or the bucket didn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any jobs that previously ran.
UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to retrieve job data for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.IsMonitoredByJob
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IsMonitoredByJob.
Specifies whether any recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible values are:
TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more recurring jobs or the bucket matches the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for one or more recurring jobs. At least one of those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED.
FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any recurring jobs, the bucket doesn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any recurring jobs, or all the recurring jobs that are configured to analyze data in the bucket have a status of CANCELLED.
UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to retrieve job data for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.LastJobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastJobId.
The unique identifier for the job that ran most recently and is configured to analyze data in the bucket, either the latest run of a recurring job or the only run of a one-time job.
This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.LastJobRunTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastJobRunTime.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job (lastJobId) started. If the job is a recurring job, this value indicates when the most recent run started.
This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the recurrence pattern for running a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency.DailySchedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DailySchedule.
Specifies a daily recurrence pattern for running the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency.MonthlySchedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MonthlySchedule.
Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency.WeeklySchedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WeeklySchedule.
Specifies a weekly recurrence pattern for running the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopeTerm
member.summary: Specifies a property- or tag-based condition that defines criteria for including or excluding S3 objects from a classification job. A JobScopeTerm object can contain only one simpleScopeTerm object or one tagScopeTerm object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SimpleScopeTerm.
A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one or more values for including or excluding objects from the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagScopeTerm.
A tag-based condition that defines the operator and tag keys or tag key and value pairs for including or excluding objects from the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopingBlock
member.summary: Specifies one or more property- and tag-based conditions that define criteria for including or excluding S3 objects from a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopingBlock.And
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property And.
An array of conditions, one for each property- or tag-based condition that determines which objects to include or exclude from the job. If you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary
member.summary: Provides information about a classification job, including the current status of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.BucketCriteria
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCriteria.
The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets are included or excluded from the job's analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these criteria to determine which buckets to analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.BucketDefinitions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketDefinitions.
An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets for the job to analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria object, not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier for the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The current status of the job. Possible values are:
CANCELLED - You cancelled the job or, if it's a one-time job, you paused the job and didn't resume it within 30 days.
COMPLETE - For a one-time job, Amazon Macie finished processing the data specified for the job. This value doesn't apply to recurring jobs.
IDLE - For a recurring job, the previous scheduled run is complete and the next scheduled run is pending. This value doesn't apply to one-time jobs.
PAUSED - Macie started running the job but additional processing would exceed the monthly sensitive data discovery quota for your account or one or more member accounts that the job analyzes data for.
RUNNING - For a one-time job, the job is in progress. For a recurring job, a scheduled run is in progress.
USER_PAUSED - You paused the job. If you paused the job while it had a status of RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days of pausing it, the job or job run will expire and be cancelled, depending on the job's type. To check the expiration date, refer to the UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.JobType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobType.
The schedule for running the job. Possible values are:
ONE_TIME - The job runs only once.
SCHEDULED - The job runs on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.LastRunErrorStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastRunErrorStatus.
Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error status of the job's most recent run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The custom name of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.UserPausedDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserPausedDetails.
If the current status of the job is USER_PAUSED, specifies when the job was paused and when the job or job run will expire and be cancelled if it isn't resumed. This value is present only if the value for jobStatus is USER_PAUSED.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.KeyValuePair
member.summary: Provides information about the tags that are associated with an S3 bucket or object. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.KeyValuePair.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.KeyValuePair.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag value acts as a descriptor for a tag key. A tag value can be an empty string.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.LastRunErrorStatus
member.summary: Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred when a classification job ran. For information about using logging data to investigate these errors, see Monitoring sensitive data discovery jobs in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.LastRunErrorStatus.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error status of the job's most recent run. Possible values are:
ERROR - One or more errors occurred. Amazon Macie didn't process all the data specified for the job.
NONE - No errors occurred. Macie processed all the data specified for the job.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ListResourceProfileArtifacts operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ListResourceProfileArtifactsResponse.Artifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Artifacts.
An array of objects, one for each of 1-100 S3 objects that Amazon Macie selected for analysis.
If Macie has analyzed more than 100 objects in the bucket, Macie populates the array based on the value for the ResourceProfileArtifact.sensitive field for an object: true (sensitive), followed by false (not sensitive). Macie then populates any remaining items in the array with information about objects where the value for the ResourceProfileArtifact.classificationResultStatus field is SKIPPED.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary
member.summary: Provides information about a managed data identifier. For additional information, see Using managed data identifiers in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary.Category
P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ManagedDataIdentifierSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the managed data identifier. This is a string that describes the type of sensitive data that the managed data identifier detects. For example: OPENSSH_PRIVATE_KEY for OpenSSH private keys, CREDIT_CARD_NUMBER for credit card numbers, or USA_PASSPORT_NUMBER for US passport numbers.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket
member.summary:
Provides statistical data and other information about an S3 bucket that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. By default, object count and storage size values include data for object parts that are the result of incomplete multipart uploads. For more information, see How Macie monitors Amazon S3 data security in the Amazon Macie User Guide.
If an error occurs when Macie attempts to retrieve and process information about the bucket or the bucket's objects, the value for most of these properties is null. Key exceptions are accountId and bucketName. To identify the cause of the error, refer to the errorCode and errorMessage values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketName.
The name of the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.ClassifiableObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifiableObjectCount.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.ClassifiableSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifiableSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
The error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.JobDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobDetails.
Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze objects in the bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.LastAutomatedDiscoveryTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastAutomatedDiscoveryTime.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Macie most recently analyzed data in the bucket while performing automated sensitive data discovery for your account. This value is null if automated sensitive data discovery is currently disabled for your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.ObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectCount.
The total number of objects in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectCountByEncryptionType.
The total number of objects in the bucket, grouped by server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.SensitivityScore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SensitivityScore.
The current sensitivity score for the bucket, ranging from -1 (classification error) to 100 (sensitive). This value is null if automated sensitive data discovery is currently disabled for your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.SizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of each object in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.SizeInBytesCompressed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SizeInBytesCompressed.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.UnclassifiableObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnclassifiableObjectCount.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingBucket.UnclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingResource
member.summary: Provides statistical data and other information about an Amazon Web Services resource that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MatchingResource.MatchingBucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MatchingBucket.
The details of an S3 bucket that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.AccountId
member.summary:

The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.AdministratorAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdministratorAccountId.
The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.Email
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Email.
The email address for the account. This value is null if the account is associated with the administrator account through Organizations.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.InvitedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvitedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon Macie membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value is null if a Macie membership invitation hasn't been sent to the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.MasterAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MasterAccountId.
(Deprecated) The Amazon Web Services account ID for the administrator account. This property has been replaced by the administratorAccountId property and is retained only for backward compatibility.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.RelationshipStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelationshipStatus.
The current status of the relationship between the account and the administrator account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map of key-value pairs that specifies which tags (keys and values) are associated with the account in Amazon Macie.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Member.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most recent change to the status of the relationship between the account and the administrator account.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MonthlySchedule
member.summary: Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.MonthlySchedule.DayOfMonth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DayOfMonth.
The numeric day of the month when Amazon Macie runs the job. This value can be an integer from 1 through 31.
If this value exceeds the number of days in a certain month, Macie doesn't run the job that month. Macie runs the job only during months that have the specified day. For example, if this value is 31 and a month has only 30 days, Macie doesn't run the job that month. To run the job every month, specify a value that's less than 29.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
member.summary: Provides information about the number of objects that are in an S3 bucket and use certain types of server-side encryption, use client-side encryption, or aren't encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.CustomerManaged
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomerManaged.
The total number of objects that are encrypted with a customer-provided key. The objects use customer-provided server-side encryption (SSE-C).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.KmsManaged
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsManaged.
The total number of objects that are encrypted with an KMS key, either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. The objects use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.S3Managed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Managed.
The total number of objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key. The objects use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.Unencrypted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unencrypted.
The total number of objects that use client-side encryption or aren't encrypted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectCountByEncryptionType.Unknown
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unknown.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the encryption settings for these objects.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectLevelStatistics
member.summary: Provides information about the total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in one or more S3 buckets. In a BucketMetadata or MatchingBucket object, this data is for a specific bucket. In a GetBucketStatisticsResponse object, this data is aggregated for all the buckets in the query results. If versioning is enabled for a bucket, storage size values are based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectLevelStatistics.FileType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileType.
The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the objects don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectLevelStatistics.StorageClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageClass.
The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage class.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ObjectLevelStatistics.Total
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Total.
The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Occurrences
member.summary: Specifies the location of 1-15 occurrences of sensitive data that was detected by a managed data identifier or a custom data identifier and produced a sensitive data finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Occurrences.Cells
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Cells.
An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in a Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file. This value is null for all other types of files.
Each Cell object specifies a cell or field that contains the sensitive data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Occurrences.LineRanges
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LineRanges.
An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an email message or a non-binary text file such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file. Each Range object specifies a line or inclusive range of lines that contains the sensitive data, and the position of the data on the specified line or lines.
This value is often null for file types that are supported by Cell, Page, or Record objects. Exceptions are the location of sensitive data in: unstructured sections of an otherwise structured file, such as a comment in a file; a malformed file that Amazon Macie analyzes as plain text; and, a CSV or TSV file that has any column names that contain sensitive data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Occurrences.OffsetRanges
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OffsetRanges.
Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Occurrences.Pages
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Pages.
An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe Portable Document Format file. This value is null for all other types of files.
Each Page object specifies a page that contains the sensitive data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Occurrences.Records
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Records.
An array of objects, one for each occurrence of sensitive data in an Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON Lines file. This value is null for all other types of files.
For an Avro object container or Parquet file, each Record object specifies a record index and the path to a field in a record that contains the sensitive data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, each Record object specifies the path to a field or array that contains the sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, it also specifies the index of the line that contains the data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Page
member.summary: Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Adobe Portable Document Format file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Page.LineRange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LineRange.
Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Page.OffsetRange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OffsetRange.
Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Page.PageNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageNumber.
The page number of the page that contains the sensitive data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PolicyDetails
member.summary: Provides the details of a policy finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PolicyDetails.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action that produced the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PolicyDetails.Actor
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Actor.
The entity that performed the action that produced the finding.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutClassificationExportConfigurationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutClassificationExportConfiguration operation. Creates or updates the configuration settings for storing data classification results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutClassificationExportConfigurationRequest.Configuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The location to store data classification results in, and the encryption settings to use when storing results in that location.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutClassificationExportConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutClassificationExportConfiguration operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutClassificationExportConfigurationResponse.Configuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The location where the data classification results are stored, and the encryption settings that are used when storing results in that location.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutFindingsPublicationConfigurationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutFindingsPublicationConfiguration operation. Updates the configuration settings for publishing findings to Security Hub.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutFindingsPublicationConfigurationRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive token that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutFindingsPublicationConfigurationRequest.SecurityHubConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityHubConfiguration.
The configuration settings that determine which findings to publish to Security Hub.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.PutFindingsPublicationConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutFindingsPublicationConfiguration operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Range
member.summary: Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an email message or a non-binary text file such as an HTML, TXT, or XML file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Range.End
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property End.
The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the end of the sensitive data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Range.Start
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Start.
The number of lines from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the sensitive data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Range.StartColumn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartColumn.
The number of characters, with spaces and starting from 1, from the beginning of the first line that contains the sensitive data (start) to the beginning of the sensitive data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Record
member.summary: Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in an Apache Avro object container, Apache Parquet file, JSON file, or JSON Lines file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Record.JsonPath
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JsonPath.
The path, as a JSONPath expression, to the sensitive data. For an Avro object container or Parquet file, this is the path to the field in the record (recordIndex) that contains the data. For a JSON or JSON Lines file, this is the path to the field or array that contains the data. If the data is a value in an array, the path also indicates which value contains the data.
If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in the path, Macie omits this field. If the name of an element exceeds 240 characters, Macie truncates the name by removing characters from the beginning of the name. If the resulting full path exceeds 250 characters, Macie also truncates the path, starting with the first element in the path, until the path contains 250 or fewer characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Record.RecordIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecordIndex.
For an Avro object container or Parquet file, the record index, starting from 0, for the record that contains the sensitive data. For a JSON Lines file, the line index, starting from 0, for the line that contains the sensitive data. This value is always 0 for JSON files.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ReplicationDetails
member.summary: Provides information about settings that define whether one or more objects in an S3 bucket are replicated to S3 buckets for other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so, which accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ReplicationDetails.Replicated
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Replicated.
Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to any destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ReplicationDetails.ReplicatedExternally
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicatedExternally.
Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to a bucket for an Amazon Web Services account that isn't part of your Amazon Macie organization. An Amazon Macie organization is a set of Macie accounts that are centrally managed as a group of related accounts through Organizations or by Macie invitation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ReplicationDetails.ReplicationAccounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationAccounts.
An array of Amazon Web Services account IDs, one for each Amazon Web Services account that owns a bucket that the bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceProfileArtifact
member.summary: Provides information about an S3 object that Amazon Macie selected for analysis while performing automated sensitive data discovery for an S3 bucket, and the status and results of the analysis. This information is available only if automated sensitive data discovery is currently enabled for your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceProfileArtifact.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceProfileArtifact.ClassificationResultStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassificationResultStatus.
The status of the analysis. Possible values are:
COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the object.
PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of data in the object. For example, the object is an archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.
SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the object. For example, the object is a malformed file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceProfileArtifact.Sensitive
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sensitive.
Specifies whether Amazon Macie found sensitive data in the object.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourcesAffected
member.summary: Provides information about the resources that a finding applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourcesAffected.S3Bucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Bucket.
The details of the S3 bucket that the finding applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourcesAffected.S3Object
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Object.
The details of the S3 object that the finding applies to.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics
member.summary: Provides statistical data for sensitive data discovery metrics that apply to an S3 bucket that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. The statistics capture the results of automated sensitive data discovery activities that Macie has performed for the bucket. The data is available only if automated sensitive data discovery is currently enabled for your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalBytesClassified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalBytesClassified.
The total amount of data, in bytes, that Amazon Macie has analyzed in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalDetections
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalDetections.
The total number of occurrences of sensitive data that Amazon Macie has found in the bucket's objects. This includes occurrences that are currently suppressed by the sensitivity scoring settings for the bucket (totalDetectionsSuppressed).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalDetectionsSuppressed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalDetectionsSuppressed.
The total number of occurrences of sensitive data that are currently suppressed by the sensitivity scoring settings for the bucket. These represent occurrences of sensitive data that Amazon Macie found in the bucket's objects, but the occurrences were manually suppressed. By default, suppressed occurrences are excluded from the bucket's sensitivity score.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalItemsClassified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalItemsClassified.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie has analyzed in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalItemsSensitive
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalItemsSensitive.
The total number of the bucket's objects that Amazon Macie has found sensitive data in.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalItemsSkipped
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalItemsSkipped.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie wasn't able to analyze in the bucket due to an object-level issue or error. For example, an object is a malformed file. This value includes objects that Macie wasn't able to analyze for reasons reported by other statistics in the ResourceStatistics object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalItemsSkippedInvalidEncryption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalItemsSkippedInvalidEncryption.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie wasn't able to analyze in the bucket because the objects are encrypted with a key that Macie can't access. The objects use server-side encryption with customer-provided keys (SSE-C).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalItemsSkippedInvalidKms
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalItemsSkippedInvalidKms.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie wasn't able to analyze in the bucket because the objects are encrypted with KMS keys that were disabled, are scheduled for deletion, or were deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ResourceStatistics.TotalItemsSkippedPermissionDenied
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalItemsSkippedPermissionDenied.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie wasn't able to analyze in the bucket due to the permissions settings for the objects or the permissions settings for the keys that were used to encrypt the objects.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.RetrievalConfiguration
member.summary: Provides information about the access method and settings that are used to retrieve occurrences of sensitive data reported by findings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.RetrievalConfiguration.ExternalId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalId.
The external ID to specify in the trust policy for the IAM role to assume when retrieving sensitive data from affected S3 objects (roleName). The trust policy must include an sts:ExternalId condition that requires this ID.
This ID is a unique alphanumeric string that Amazon Macie generates automatically after you configure it to assume a role. This value is null if the value for retrievalMode is CALLER_CREDENTIALS.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.RetrievalConfiguration.RetrievalMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetrievalMode.
The access method that's used when retrieving sensitive data from affected S3 objects. Valid values are: ASSUME_ROLE, assume an IAM role that is in the affected Amazon Web Services account and delegates access to Amazon Macie (roleName); and, CALLER_CREDENTIALS, use the credentials of the IAM user who requests the sensitive data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.RetrievalConfiguration.RoleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleName.
The name of the IAM role that is in the affected Amazon Web Services account and Amazon Macie is allowed to assume when retrieving sensitive data from affected S3 objects for the account. This value is null if the value for retrievalMode is CALLER_CREDENTIALS.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.RevealConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the status of the Amazon Macie configuration for retrieving occurrences of sensitive data reported by findings, and the Key Management Service (KMS) key to use to encrypt sensitive data that's retrieved. When you enable the configuration for the first time, your request must specify an KMS key. Otherwise, an error occurs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.RevealConfiguration.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN), ID, or alias of the KMS key to use to encrypt sensitive data that's retrieved. The key must be an existing, customer managed, symmetric encryption key that's enabled in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the Amazon Macie account.
If this value specifies an alias, it must include the following prefix: alias/. If this value specifies a key that's owned by another Amazon Web Services account, it must specify the ARN of the key or the ARN of the key's alias.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.RevealConfiguration.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the configuration for the Amazon Macie account. In a request, valid values are: ENABLED, enable the configuration for the account; and, DISABLED, disable the configuration for the account. In a response, possible values are: ENABLED, the configuration is currently enabled for the account; and, DISABLED, the configuration is currently disabled for the account.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket
member.summary: Provides information about the S3 bucket that a finding applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads.
Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires server-side encryption of objects when objects are added to the bucket. Possible values are:
FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new objects. PutObject requests must include a valid server-side encryption header.
TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to include a valid server-side encryption header.
UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new objects.
Valid server-side encryption headers are: x-amz-server-side-encryption with a value of AES256 or aws:kms, and x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm with a value of AES256.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was created. This value can also indicate when changes such as edits to the bucket's policy were most recently made to the bucket, relative to when the finding was created or last updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.DefaultServerSideEncryption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultServerSideEncryption.
The default server-side encryption settings for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.Owner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Owner.
The display name and canonical user ID for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.PublicAccess
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PublicAccess.
The permissions settings that determine whether the bucket is publicly accessible.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Bucket.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags that are associated with the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketCriteriaForJob
member.summary: Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define criteria for including or excluding S3 buckets from a classification job. Exclude conditions take precedence over include conditions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketCriteriaForJob.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to exclude from the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketCriteriaForJob.Includes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Includes.
The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which buckets to include in the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketDefinitionForJob
member.summary: Specifies an Amazon Web Services account that owns S3 buckets for a classification job to analyze, and one or more specific buckets to analyze for that account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketDefinitionForJob.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketDefinitionForJob.Buckets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Buckets.
An array that lists the names of the buckets.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketOwner
member.summary: Provides information about the Amazon Web Services account that owns an S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketOwner.DisplayName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisplayName.
The display name of the account that owns the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3BucketOwner.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The canonical user ID for the account that owns the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScope
member.summary: Specifies the S3 buckets that are excluded from automated sensitive data discovery for an Amazon Macie account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScope.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
The S3 buckets that are excluded.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScopeExclusion
member.summary: Specifies the names of the S3 buckets that are excluded from automated sensitive data discovery.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScopeExclusion.BucketNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketNames.
An array of strings, one for each S3 bucket that is excluded. Each string is the full name of an excluded bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScopeExclusionUpdate
member.summary: Specifies S3 buckets to add or remove from the exclusion list defined by the classification scope for an Amazon Macie account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScopeExclusionUpdate.BucketNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketNames.
Depending on the value specified for the update operation (ClassificationScopeUpdateOperation), an array of strings that: lists the names of buckets to add or remove from the list, or specifies a new set of bucket names that overwrites all existing names in the list. Each string must be the full name of an S3 bucket. Values are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScopeExclusionUpdate.Operation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operation.
Specifies how to apply the changes to the exclusion list. Valid values are:
ADD - Append the specified bucket names to the current list.
REMOVE - Remove the specified bucket names from the current list.
REPLACE - Overwrite the current list with the specified list of bucket names. If you specify this value, Amazon Macie removes all existing names from the list and adds all the specified names to the list.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScopeUpdate
member.summary: Specifies changes to the list of S3 buckets that are excluded from automated sensitive data discovery for an Amazon Macie account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3ClassificationScopeUpdate.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
The names of the S3 buckets to add or remove from the list.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Destination
member.summary: Specifies an S3 bucket to store data classification results in, and the encryption settings to use when storing results in that bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Destination.BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketName.
The name of the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Destination.KeyPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KeyPrefix.
The path prefix to use in the path to the location in the bucket. This prefix specifies where to store classification results in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Destination.KmsKeyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key to use for encryption of the results. This must be the ARN of an existing, symmetric encryption KMS key that's enabled in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3JobDefinition
member.summary: Specifies which S3 buckets contain the objects that a classification job analyzes, and the scope of that analysis. The bucket specification can be static (bucketDefinitions) or dynamic (bucketCriteria). If it's static, the job analyzes objects in the same predefined set of buckets each time the job runs. If it's dynamic, the job analyzes objects in any buckets that match the specified criteria each time the job starts to run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3JobDefinition.BucketCriteria
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCriteria.
The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these criteria to determine which buckets contain objects to analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3JobDefinition.BucketDefinitions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketDefinitions.
An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets to analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria object, not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3JobDefinition.Scoping
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Scoping.
The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 objects to include or exclude from the analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these criteria to determine which objects to analyze.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Object
member.summary: Provides information about the S3 object that a finding applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Object.BucketArn
member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket that contains the object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Object.ETag
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ETag.
The entity tag (ETag) that identifies the affected version of the object. If the object was overwritten or changed after Amazon Macie produced the finding, this value might be different from the current ETag for the object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Object.Extension
member.summary:

The file name extension of the object. If the object doesn't have a file name extension, this value is "".

The full name (key) of the object, including the object's prefix if applicable.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Object.LastModified

The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the object was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Object.Path
member.summary:

The full path to the affected object, including the name of the affected bucket and the object's name (key).

member.summary:

Specifies whether the object is publicly accessible due to the combination of permissions settings that apply to the object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.S3Object.ServerSideEncryption

The type of server-side encryption that was used to encrypt the object.

The total storage size, in bytes, of the object.

member.summary: Specifies property- and tag-based conditions that define filter criteria for including or excluding Amazon Web Services resources from the query results.

member.summary:

An array of objects, one for each property- or tag-based condition that includes or excludes resources from the query results. If you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SearchResources operation. Retrieves (queries) statistical data and other information about Amazon Web Services resources that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCriteria.
The filter conditions that determine which S3 buckets to include or exclude from the query results.

member.summary:

member.summary:

The nextToken string that specifies which page of results to return in a paginated response.

The criteria to use to sort the results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesResponse.MatchingResources
member.summary:

An array of objects, one for each resource that matches the filter criteria specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:

The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion
member.summary: Specifies a property-based filter condition that determines which Amazon Web Services resources are included or excluded from the query results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.Comparator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Comparator.
The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The property to use in the condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesSimpleCriterion.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the resource.
S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an enumerated value that Macie defines for the BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission property of an S3 bucket.
S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of an S3 bucket.
S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated value that Macie defines for the BucketMetadata.sharedAccess property of an S3 bucket.
Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial values or wildcard characters in values.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesSortCriteria
member.summary: Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query for information about Amazon Web Services resources that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesSortCriteria.AttributeName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeName.
The property to sort the results by.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesSortCriteria.OrderBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderBy.
The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the property specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesTagCriterion
member.summary: Specifies a tag-based filter condition that determines which Amazon Web Services resources are included or excluded from the query results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesTagCriterion.Comparator
member.summary:

The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesTagCriterion.TagValues
member.summary:

The tag keys, tag values, or tag key and value pairs to use in the condition.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesTagCriterionPair
member.summary: Specifies a tag key, a tag value, or a tag key and value (as a pair) to use in a tag-based filter condition for a query. Tag keys and values are case sensitive. Also, Amazon Macie doesn't support use of partial values or wildcard characters in tag-based filter conditions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesTagCriterionPair.Key
member.summary:

The value for the tag key to use in the condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SearchResourcesTagCriterionPair.Value

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SecurityHubConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies configuration settings that determine which findings are published to Security Hub automatically. For information about how Macie publishes findings to Security Hub, see Amazon Macie integration with Security Hub in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SecurityHubConfiguration.PublishClassificationFindings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PublishClassificationFindings.
Specifies whether to publish sensitive data findings to Security Hub. If you set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes all sensitive data findings that weren't suppressed by a findings filter. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SecurityHubConfiguration.PublishPolicyFindings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PublishPolicyFindings.
Specifies whether to publish policy findings to Security Hub. If you set this value to true, Amazon Macie automatically publishes all new and updated policy findings that weren't suppressed by a findings filter. The default value is true.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitiveDataItem
member.summary: Provides information about the category, types, and occurrences of sensitive data that produced a sensitive data finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitiveDataItem.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
The category of sensitive data that was detected. For example: CREDENTIALS, for credentials data such as private keys or Amazon Web Services secret access keys; FINANCIAL_INFORMATION, for financial data such as credit card numbers; or, PERSONAL_INFORMATION, for personal health information, such as health insurance identification numbers, or personally identifiable information, such as passport numbers.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitiveDataItem.Detections
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Detections.
An array of objects, one for each type of sensitive data that was detected. Each object reports the number of occurrences of a specific type of sensitive data that was detected, and the location of up to 15 of those occurrences.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitiveDataItem.TotalCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalCount.
The total number of occurrences of the sensitive data that was detected.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityAggregations
member.summary: Provides aggregated statistical data for sensitive data discovery metrics that apply to S3 buckets. Each field contains aggregated data for all the buckets that have a sensitivity score (sensitivityScore) of a specified value or within a specified range (BucketStatisticsBySensitivity). If automated sensitive data discovery is currently disabled for your account, the value for each field is 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityAggregations.ClassifiableSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifiableSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of all the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the buckets. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, this value is based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in the buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of all applicable objects in the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityAggregations.PubliclyAccessibleCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PubliclyAccessibleCount.
The total number of buckets that are publicly accessible due to a combination of permissions settings for each bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityAggregations.TotalCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalCount.
The total number of buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityAggregations.TotalSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the buckets.
If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, this value is based on the size of the latest version of each object in the buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of the objects in the buckets.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplateExcludes
member.summary: Specifies managed data identifiers to exclude (not use) when performing automated sensitive data discovery for an Amazon Macie account. For information about the managed data identifiers that Amazon Macie currently provides, see Using managed data identifiers in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplateExcludes.ManagedDataIdentifierIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManagedDataIdentifierIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each managed data identifier to exclude. To retrieve a list of valid values, use the ListManagedDataIdentifiers operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplateIncludes
member.summary: Specifies the allow lists, custom data identifiers, and managed data identifiers to include (use) when performing automated sensitive data discovery for an Amazon Macie account. The configuration must specify at least one custom data identifier or managed data identifier. For information about the managed data identifiers that Amazon Macie currently provides, see Using managed data identifiers in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplateIncludes.AllowListIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowListIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each allow list to include.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplateIncludes.CustomDataIdentifierIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomDataIdentifierIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each custom data identifier to include.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplateIncludes.ManagedDataIdentifierIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManagedDataIdentifierIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each managed data identifier to include.
Amazon Macie uses these managed data identifiers in addition to managed data identifiers that are subsequently released and recommended for automated sensitive data discovery. To retrieve a list of valid values for the managed data identifiers that are currently available, use the ListManagedDataIdentifiers operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplatesEntry
member.summary: Provides information about the sensitivity inspection template for an Amazon Macie account. Macie uses the template's settings when it performs automated sensitive data discovery for the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SensitivityInspectionTemplatesEntry.Name
member.summary:

The name of the sensitivity inspection template: automated-sensitive-data-discovery.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ServerSideEncryption.EncryptionType
member.summary:

The server-side encryption algorithm that's used when storing data in the bucket or object. If default encryption settings aren't configured for the bucket or the object isn't encrypted using server-side encryption, this value is NONE.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ServerSideEncryption.KmsMasterKeyId

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Severity
member.summary: Provides the numerical and qualitative representations of a finding's severity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Severity.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The qualitative representation of the finding's severity, ranging from Low (least severe) to High (most severe).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Severity.Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Score.
The numerical representation of the finding's severity, ranging from 1 (least severe) to 3 (most severe).

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SeverityLevel
member.summary: Specifies a severity level for findings that a custom data identifier produces. A severity level determines which severity is assigned to the findings, based on the number of occurrences of text that match the custom data identifier's detection criteria.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SeverityLevel.OccurrencesThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OccurrencesThreshold.
The minimum number of occurrences of text that must match the custom data identifier's detection criteria in order to produce a finding with the specified severity (severity).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SeverityLevel.Severity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Severity.
The severity to assign to a finding: if the number of occurrences is greater than or equal to the specified threshold (occurrencesThreshold); and, if applicable, the number of occurrences is less than the threshold for the next consecutive severity level for the custom data identifier, moving from LOW to HIGH.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleCriterionForJob
member.summary: Specifies a property-based condition that determines whether an S3 bucket is included or excluded from a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleCriterionForJob.Comparator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Comparator.
The operator to use in the condition. Valid values are EQ (equals) and NE (not equals).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleCriterionForJob.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The property to use in the condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleCriterionForJob.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
An array that lists one or more values to use in the condition. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the values. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
ACCOUNT_ID - A string that represents the unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.
S3_BUCKET_EFFECTIVE_PERMISSION - A string that represents an enumerated value that Macie defines for the BucketPublicAccess.effectivePermission property of a bucket.
S3_BUCKET_NAME - A string that represents the name of a bucket.
S3_BUCKET_SHARED_ACCESS - A string that represents an enumerated value that Macie defines for the BucketMetadata.sharedAccess property of a bucket.
Values are case sensitive. Also, Macie doesn't support use of partial values or wildcard characters in these values.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleScopeTerm
member.summary: Specifies a property-based condition that determines whether an S3 object is included or excluded from a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleScopeTerm.Comparator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Comparator.
The operator to use in the condition. Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
OBJECT_EXTENSION - EQ (equals) or NE (not equals)
OBJECT_KEY - STARTS_WITH
OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - EQ (equals), GT (greater than), GTE (greater than or equals), LT (less than), LTE (less than or equals), or NE (not equals)
OBJECT_SIZE - EQ (equals), GT (greater than), GTE (greater than or equals), LT (less than), LTE (less than or equals), or NE (not equals)

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleScopeTerm.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The object property to use in the condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SimpleScopeTerm.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
An array that lists the values to use in the condition. If the value for the key property is OBJECT_EXTENSION or OBJECT_KEY, this array can specify multiple values and Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
Valid values for each supported property (key) are:
OBJECT_EXTENSION - A string that represents the file name extension of an object. For example: docx or pdf
OBJECT_KEY - A string that represents the key prefix (folder name or path) of an object. For example: logs or awslogs/eventlogs. This value applies a condition to objects whose keys (names) begin with the specified value.
OBJECT_LAST_MODIFIED_DATE - The date and time (in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format) when an object was created or last changed, whichever is latest. For example: 2023-09-24T14:31:13Z
OBJECT_SIZE - An integer that represents the storage size (in bytes) of an object.
Macie doesn't support use of wildcard characters in these values. Also, string values are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SortCriteria.AttributeName

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.SortCriteria.OrderBy
member.summary:
