member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the TestCustomDataIdentifier operation. Tests a custom data identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest.IgnoreWords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IgnoreWords.
An array that lists specific character sequences (ignore words) to exclude from the results. If the text matched by the regular expression contains any string in this array, Amazon Macie ignores it. The array can contain as many as 10 ignore words. Each ignore word can contain 4-90 UTF-8 characters. Ignore words are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest.Keywords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Keywords.
An array that lists specific character sequences (keywords), one of which must precede and be within proximity (maximumMatchDistance) of the regular expression to match. The array can contain as many as 50 keywords. Each keyword can contain 3-90 UTF-8 characters. Keywords aren't case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest.MaximumMatchDistance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaximumMatchDistance.
The maximum number of characters that can exist between the end of at least one complete character sequence specified by the keywords array and the end of the text that matches the regex pattern. If a complete keyword precedes all the text that matches the pattern and the keyword is within the specified distance, Amazon Macie includes the result. The distance can be 1-300 characters. The default value is 50.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest.Regex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Regex.
The regular expression (regex) that defines the pattern to match. The expression can contain as many as 512 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest.SampleText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SampleText.
The sample text to inspect by using the custom data identifier. The text can contain as many as 1,000 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the TestCustomDataIdentifier operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.TestCustomDataIdentifierResponse.MatchCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MatchCount.
The number of occurrences of sample text that matched the criteria specified by the custom data identifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateAutomatedDiscoveryConfigurationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateAutomatedDiscoveryConfiguration operation. Enables or disables automated sensitive data discovery for an account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateAutomatedDiscoveryConfigurationRequest.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The new status of automated sensitive data discovery for the account. Valid values are: ENABLED, start or resume automated sensitive data discovery activities for the account; and, DISABLED, stop performing automated sensitive data discovery activities for the account.
When you enable automated sensitive data discovery for the first time, Amazon Macie uses default configuration settings to determine which data sources to analyze and which managed data identifiers to use. To change these settings, use the UpdateClassificationScope and UpdateSensitivityInspectionTemplate operations, respectively. If you change the settings and subsequently disable the configuration, Amazon Macie retains your changes.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateAutomatedDiscoveryConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateAutomatedDiscoveryConfiguration operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateClassificationJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateClassificationJob operation. Changes the status of a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateClassificationJobRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier for the classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateClassificationJobRequest.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The new status for the job. Valid values are:
CANCELLED - Stops the job permanently and cancels it. This value is valid only if the job's current status is IDLE, PAUSED, RUNNING, or USER_PAUSED.
If you specify this value and the job's current status is RUNNING, Amazon Macie immediately begins to stop all processing tasks for the job. You can't resume or restart a job after you cancel it.
RUNNING - Resumes the job. This value is valid only if the job's current status is USER_PAUSED.
If you paused the job while it was actively running and you specify this value less than 30 days after you paused the job, Macie immediately resumes processing from the point where you paused the job. Otherwise, Macie resumes the job according to the schedule and other settings for the job.
USER_PAUSED - Pauses the job temporarily. This value is valid only if the job's current status is IDLE, PAUSED, or RUNNING. If you specify this value and the job's current status is RUNNING, Macie immediately begins to pause all processing tasks for the job.
If you pause a one-time job and you don't resume it within 30 days, the job expires and Macie cancels the job. If you pause a recurring job when its status is RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days, the job run expires and Macie cancels the run. To check the expiration date, refer to the UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateClassificationJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateClassificationJob operation.

We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the description of a filter. Other users of your account might be able to see this description, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.

member.summary:

A custom name for the filter. The name must contain at least 3 characters and can contain as many as 64 characters.
We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the name of a filter. Other users of your account might be able to see this name, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateFindingsFilterRequest.Position
member.summary:

The position of the filter in the list of saved filters on the Amazon Macie console. This value also determines the order in which the filter is applied to findings, relative to other filters that are also applied to the findings.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateRetrievalConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the access method and settings to use when retrieving occurrences of sensitive data reported by findings. If your request specifies an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to assume when retrieving the sensitive data, Amazon Macie verifies that the role exists and the attached policies are configured correctly. If there's an issue, Macie returns an error. For information about addressing the issue, see Retrieving sensitive data samples with findings in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateRetrievalConfiguration.RetrievalMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetrievalMode.
The access method to use when retrieving sensitive data from affected S3 objects. Valid values are: ASSUME_ROLE, assume an IAM role that is in the affected Amazon Web Services account and delegates access to Amazon Macie; and, CALLER_CREDENTIALS, use the credentials of the IAM user who requests the sensitive data. If you specify ASSUME_ROLE, also specify the name of an existing IAM role for Macie to assume (roleName).
If you change this value from ASSUME_ROLE to CALLER_CREDENTIALS for an existing configuration, Macie permanently deletes the external ID and role name currently specified for the configuration. These settings can't be recovered after they're deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateRetrievalConfiguration.RoleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleName.
The name of the IAM role that is in the affected Amazon Web Services account and Amazon Macie is allowed to assume when retrieving sensitive data from affected S3 objects for the account. The trust and permissions policies for the role must meet all requirements for Macie to assume the role.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateRevealConfigurationRequest

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateSensitivityInspectionTemplateRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A custom description of the template. The description can contain as many as 200 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateSensitivityInspectionTemplateRequest.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
The managed data identifiers to explicitly exclude (not use) when analyzing data.
To exclude an allow list or custom data identifier that's currently included by the template, update the values for the SensitivityInspectionTemplateIncludes.allowListIds and SensitivityInspectionTemplateIncludes.customDataIdentifierIds properties, respectively.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateSensitivityInspectionTemplateRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the Amazon Macie resource that the request applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateSensitivityInspectionTemplateRequest.Includes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Includes.
The allow lists, custom data identifiers, and managed data identifiers to explicitly include (use) when analyzing data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UpdateSensitivityInspectionTemplateResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateSensitivityInspectionTemplate operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageByAccount
member.summary: Provides data for a specific usage metric and the corresponding quota for an Amazon Macie account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageByAccount.Currency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Currency.
The type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is reported in.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageByAccount.EstimatedCost
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EstimatedCost.
The estimated value for the metric.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageByAccount.ServiceLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceLimit.
The current value for the quota that corresponds to the metric specified by the type field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageByAccount.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The name of the metric. Possible values are: AUTOMATED_OBJECT_MONITORING, to monitor S3 objects for automated sensitive data discovery; AUTOMATED_SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, to analyze S3 objects for automated sensitive data discovery; DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION, to monitor S3 buckets; and, SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, to run classification jobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageRecord
member.summary: Provides quota and aggregated usage data for an Amazon Macie account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageRecord.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that the data applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageRecord.AutomatedDiscoveryFreeTrialStartDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutomatedDiscoveryFreeTrialStartDate.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the free trial of automated sensitive data discovery started for the account. If the account is a member account in an organization, this value is the same as the value for the organization's Amazon Macie administrator account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageRecord.FreeTrialStartDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FreeTrialStartDate.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the Amazon Macie free trial started for the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageRecord.Usage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Usage.
An array of objects that contains usage data and quotas for the account. Each object contains the data for a specific usage metric and the corresponding quota.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageStatisticsFilter
member.summary: Specifies a condition for filtering the results of a query for quota and usage data for one or more Amazon Macie accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageStatisticsFilter.Comparator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Comparator.
The operator to use in the condition. If the value for the key property is accountId, this value must be CONTAINS. If the value for the key property is any other supported field, this value can be EQ, GT, GTE, LT, LTE, or NE.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageStatisticsFilter.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The field to use in the condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageStatisticsFilter.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
An array that lists values to use in the condition, based on the value for the field specified by the key property. If the value for the key property is accountId, this array can specify multiple values. Otherwise, this array can specify only one value.
Valid values for each supported field are:
accountId - The unique identifier for an Amazon Web Services account.
freeTrialStartDate - The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the Amazon Macie free trial started for an account.
serviceLimit - A Boolean (true or false) value that indicates whether an account has reached its monthly quota.
total - A string that represents the current estimated cost for an account.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageStatisticsSortBy
member.summary: Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query for Amazon Macie account quotas and usage data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageStatisticsSortBy.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The field to sort the results by.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageStatisticsSortBy.OrderBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderBy.
The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value for the field specified by the key property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageTotal
member.summary: Provides aggregated data for an Amazon Macie usage metric. The value for the metric reports estimated usage data for an account for the preceding 30 days or the current calendar month to date, depending on the time period (timeRange) specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageTotal.Currency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Currency.
The type of currency that the value for the metric (estimatedCost) is reported in.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageTotal.EstimatedCost
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EstimatedCost.
The estimated value for the metric.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UsageTotal.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The name of the metric. Possible values are: AUTOMATED_OBJECT_MONITORING, to monitor S3 objects for automated sensitive data discovery; AUTOMATED_SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, to analyze S3 objects for automated sensitive data discovery; DATA_INVENTORY_EVALUATION, to monitor S3 buckets; and, SENSITIVE_DATA_DISCOVERY, to run classification jobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity.AssumedRole
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity.AwsAccount
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity.AwsService
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity.FederatedUser
member.summary:

If the action was performed with temporary security credentials that were obtained using the GetFederationToken operation of the Security Token Service (STS) API, the identifiers, session context, and other details about the identity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity.IamUser
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamUser.
If the action was performed using the credentials for an Identity and Access Management (IAM) user, the name and other details about the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity.Root
member.summary:

If the action was performed using the credentials for your Amazon Web Services account, the details of your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentity.Type
member.summary:

The type of entity that performed the action.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentityRoot
member.summary: Provides information about an Amazon Web Services account and entity that performed an action on an affected resource. The action was performed using the credentials for your Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentityRoot.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentityRoot.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user or role that performed the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserIdentityRoot.PrincipalId
member.summary:

The unique identifier for the entity that performed the action.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserPausedDetails
member.summary: Provides information about when a classification job was paused. For a one-time job, this object also specifies when the job will expire and be cancelled if it isn't resumed. For a recurring job, this object also specifies when the paused job run will expire and be cancelled if it isn't resumed. This object is present only if a job's current status (jobStatus) is USER_PAUSED. The information in this object applies only to a job that was paused while it had a status of RUNNING.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserPausedDetails.JobExpiresAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobExpiresAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job or job run will expire and be cancelled if you don't resume it first.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserPausedDetails.JobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobImminentExpirationHealthEventArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Health event that Amazon Macie sent to notify you of the job or job run's pending expiration and cancellation. This value is null if a job has been paused for less than 23 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.UserPausedDetails.JobPausedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobPausedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when you paused the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.AmazonMacie2Client
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Macie2
Amazon Macie

member.name: M:Amazon.Macie2.AmazonMacie2Client.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMacie2Client with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Macie2.AmazonMacie2Client.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMacie2Client with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.
